document_title: What is dyslipidemia? Causes, symptoms, prevention
subsection_name: roi-loan-lipid-mau.json_9_How to care for people with lipid disorders
subsection_content:
Although dyslipidemia puts people at risk for heart attack and stroke, you can still protect yourself by living a healthier lifestyle and taking medication if needed. Be sure to follow your doctor's instructions for best results.
Quit smoking; Get enough sleep; Reduce stress; Eat healthier foods; Limit alcohol intake; Maintain a healthy weight; Exercise regularly; Limit fat and animal viscera, increase eating green vegetables.
See more: What should you eat and avoid if you have dyslipidemia? 15 foods to keep in mind
In addition, patients need to comply with the time and dosage of medication as prescribed by the doctor, make sure to continue using the medication according to the instructions on the label, and have regular check-ups as scheduled.
